location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in rough chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 377; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file comprises telegrams, despatches, correspondence, memoranda, and notes, on a wide variety of miscellaneous topics which are ordered in the file by chronology. Topics include:thefts of telephone wire (sabotage) and shooting of Persians by Indian troopstranslation of a memorandum from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Tehran, to His Majesty's Legation, Tehran (ff 287-288)the Imperial Iranian Government's proclamation regarding war with Germany (folio 41)strikes in Persian factories for higher wagesactivities of Persian politicians and religious officialsBritish accounts of Soviet and American perspectives on the situation in Persiaelection regulations (ff 96-102)The principal correspondents in the file include the Under-Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs and HM Consulates at Isfahan, Tabriz and Ahwaz.The file includes a divider, which gives a list of correspondence references contained in the file by year. This is placed at the back of the correspondence.
